analysis.parsing package

Submodules

analysis.parsing.load module

Central location from which other modules can source data from the parsed C-files.

analysis.parsing.load.extr_values(file)[source]

Search for constants, enum correspondences and other global values in the headers.

analysis.parsing.par_cfile module

This module serves the purpose of parsing C files containing basic information about the various packet to be included in the MIB database.

Bases: instance_og

analysis.parsing.par_header module

This module serves the purpose of parsing C header files containing information about the structure of packets.

Parse the given string into blocks of “top-level” C-structures.

analysis.parsing.par_header.str_parse_r(offset, stri)[source]

Parse the given string into blocks of C-structures. But this time “second-order” strings are expected and the parsing is recursive.

analysis.parsing.par_methods module

This module holds various methods used for parsing of the header and normal C files.

analysis.parsing.par_methods.clean(stri, tokens)[source]

Replace tokens with spaces.

analysis.parsing.par_methods.com_parse(comm)[source]

Parse the comments in the string into blocks corresponding to singular comments.

class analysis.parsing.par_methods.comment(start, end, text)[source]

Bases: object

class of an occurence of a comment in the file

analysis.parsing.par_methods.erase_text(stri)[source]

Erase all text inside quatation marks in the given string.

analysis.parsing.par_methods.line_index(stri)[source]

Give list of indexes of line starts of the given string.

analysis.parsing.par_methods.preproc_eval(variab)[source]

Evaluate whether a pre-processing condition holds.

analysis.parsing.par_methods.preproc_filter(stri)[source]

Filter out what parts of the C-code should be further considered based on preprocessor directives.

analysis.parsing.par_methods.preproc_parse(stri)[source]

Parse C-preprocessor conditional syntax into logic blocks.

analysis.parsing.par_methods.split_comment(stri)[source]

Split the given string into a section with C comments and a section without them.

analysis.parsing.parser_main module

This module is a starting point for parsing of C-files and holds class which plays the role of their interpretation.

class analysis.parsing.parser_main.file(stri, header)[source]

Bases: object

class resresenting the file being analysed, its structure, etc…

Parameters:
stri: string

a string of the file text to be parsed

header: boolean

parameter denoting whether file is a header or normal C file

linker()[source]

Link each comment to a corresponding C-object in the file

Returns:
pairs: list

pairs of comments and their corresponding objects

analysis.parsing.parser_main.main(name='/home/vachaj11/Documents/MIB/start/src/PUS_TmDefs.h')[source]

Created a parsed Python representation from the given file.

Parameters:
name: string

Path to the file
